oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Articles of agreement between Assistant Quartermaster E. B. Whitman and John M. Palmer for coffins and fences

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; National cemeteries; Coffins; Fences; Contracts
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Articles of agreement between Assistant Quartermaster E. B. Whitman and John M. Palmer for coffins for national cemeteries located at or near Natchez, Vicksburg, Corinth, Memphis, Pittsburg Landing, Fort Donelson, Nashville, and Marietta. Document specifies number of coffins for each location and orders fences around cemeteries at or near Natchez, Corinth, Fort Donelson, and Pittsburg Landing.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1860-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The various cemeteries listed are located at or near major engagements that occurred during the war. The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay. In 1862, the Quartermaster's Department also assumed responsibility for burial of war dead and care of national cemeteries.
